revision_history.author: Test Engineering Team
revision_history.changes: Initial protocol release based on IEC 61215-2:2016 MQT 10

equipment_requirements: UV chamber with UVA fluorescent lamps

sample_requirements.conditioning: Pre-test at STC, document baseline performance
sample_requirements.traceability: Serial number, manufacturing date, initial Pmax

cumulative_dose.measurement: Continuous integration via calibrated UV sensor
cumulative_dose.calculation: ∫(E_UV * dt) where E_UV is spectral irradiance

spatial_uniformity.acceptance: All points within ±10% of average irradiance

pre_test_preparation.details: Document any existing defects, discoloration, or damage
pre_test_preparation.acceptance: Module must be free of manufacturing defects

pre_test_preparation.details: Measure I-V curve at STC (1000 W/m², 25°C, AM1.5G)
pre_test_preparation.documentation: Store reference curve and all parameters

pre_test_preparation.details: Baseline EL image to identify existing cell defects
pre_test_preparation.settings: Forward bias at Isc, high-resolution camera

pre_test_preparation.details: Verify chamber cleanliness, lamp hours, calibration status
Compare working standards to reference sensor

test_execution.details: Mount module in test plane with front surface facing lamps
requirements: Temperature sensor attached to backsheet center
UV sensor positioned adjacent to module

test_execution.details: Begin dose integration and data logging
test_execution.monitoring: Automated system logs irradiance, temperature, dose every 15 min

test_execution.details: Visual check through chamber window for obvious changes
test_execution.documentation: Log any observed changes (yellowing, delamination, etc.)

test_execution.details: Clean chamber windows, verify lamp operation, check cooling system
At 25%, 50%, 75% dose completion: remove module, measure STC performance
Stop exposure when target dose achieved within ±5%
test_execution.verification: Cross-check dose from primary and secondary sensors

post_test_evaluation.details: Allow module to cool and stabilize for 24 hours
Document all changes: discoloration, delamination, bubbles, corrosion

post_test_evaluation.comparison: Calculate percentage change in Pmax, Voc, Isc, FF

post_test_evaluation.details: Compare to baseline EL, identify new defects or propagation
post_test_evaluation.analysis: Quantify dark area percentage, cell cracking

post_test_evaluation.details: Per IEC 61215-2 MQT 01, measure ground leakage

major_defects: No significant delamination (> 10% of cell area)
No bubbles in encapsulant (> 5 mm diameter)
minor_defects_acceptable: Edge seal discoloration < 5 mm from frame

uv_dose_received.traceability: Calibrated UV sensor serial number and calibration date

imagery.thermal_images: If hot spots develop during testing

solar_simulator.standard: Reference cell calibrated at accredited laboratory
solar_simulator.acceptance: Spectral match, non-uniformity, temporal instability per IEC 60904-9

chamber_irradiance.action: Investigate if out of limits for 2 consecutive days

reference_module.parameter: Monthly STC power measurement of control module
reference_module.action: Recalibrate if trending or out of limits

inter_laboratory_comparison.method: Round-robin test with other IEC 17025 labs
inter_laboratory_comparison.acceptance: Results within expanded uncertainty of consensus value

lamp_replacement.trigger: Every 2000 hours or when irradiance drops below 90% of initial
procedure: Power down chamber and allow 30-minute cooldown
Remove and dispose of old lamps per hazardous waste protocol
Install new lamps (record serial numbers and installation date)
Run chamber for 100-hour burn-in before testing modules
Verify spectral distribution and irradiance uniformity
lamp_replacement.documentation: Log lamp S/N, date, burn-in hours

window_cleaning.verification: Visual inspection for smudges or deposits

filter_replacement.components: HVAC filters in chamber air circulation system
filter_replacement.purpose: Prevent dust accumulation on modules and sensors

sensor_cleaning.method: Dry compressed air or soft brush

electrical_test_equipment.checks: Verify reference cell short-circuit current, zero offsets

quarterly_tasks: Full chamber calibration with NIST-traceable standards
Control chart review and trending analysis
annual_tasks: UV sensor recalibration at accredited laboratory

immediate_action: Pause test and document current dose
Investigate cause (lamp aging, power supply, sensor drift)
If sensor drift: verify with secondary sensor
If lamp aging: replace lamps and resume after burn-in
If power supply issue: repair before resuming
irradiance_out_of_specification.dose_correction: May continue test if corrected quickly; document interruption duration

immediate_action: Document time and magnitude of excursion
Check cooling system and chamber seals
If module temperature > 70°C: halt test, allow cooldown, inspect for damage
temperature_excursion.impact_assessment: Minor excursions (< 4 hours) may be acceptable with documented justification

power_failure.condition: Loss of AC power to chamber
immediate_action: Document outage duration and cumulative dose at failure
After power restoration: verify lamp function and re-stabilize chamber
power_failure.test_validity: Valid if total interruptions < 5% of exposure time

module_failure_during_test.condition: Visible damage, arcing, or catastrophic degradation
immediate_action: Immediately stop test and isolate module
Report to engineering team and module manufacturer
module_failure_during_test.investigation: Full forensic analysis including cross-sectioning if needed

immediate_action: Do not use sensor until recalibrated
Review all tests performed since last calibration
Assess impact on historical data (may require uncertainty expansion)
calibration_out_of_tolerance.corrective_action: Increase calibration frequency if recurring issue

required_documents: Test plan with module identification and target dose
Baseline I-V curve and EL image
Final I-V curve and EL image
Test report summarizing results and pass/fail determination
test_record_package.format: Electronic with digital signatures, backup to redundant storage

chain_of_custody.module_tracking: Barcode or RFID scan at every transfer

data_integrity.automated_logging: Direct digital acquisition, no manual transcription
data_integrity.checksums: MD5 or SHA-256 for all electronic data files

internal_report.content: Detailed results, uncertainty analysis, raw data plots
internal_report.format: PDF with embedded Excel data sheets

customer_report.content: Executive summary, pass/fail statement, key plots

regulatory_submission.content: Full test record package with chain of custody

controls: Chamber interlocks prevent door opening when lamps energized
Training on UV safety for all personnel

required_ppe: Safety glasses with UV protection when accessing chamber
Thermal gloves for handling warm modules
ESD wrist strap when handling electronics

environmental_considerations.lamp_disposal: Recycle or dispose as universal waste per EPA guidelines
environmental_considerations.energy_consumption: Typical 10-20 kW for extended periods; schedule tests to optimize energy use

personnel_qualifications: Test technician: High school diploma + 6 months lab experience
Test engineer: BS in engineering or physics + 2 years PV testing experience
All personnel: IEC 61215 test sequence training

competency_assessment.initial: Shadow experienced technician for 3 tests, then perform 1 test under supervision
competency_assessment.ongoing: Annual refresher on UV safety and calibration procedures

standards_documents: IEC 61215-2:2016 - Terrestrial PV modules - Design qualification and type approval - Part 2: Test procedures
IEC 61730-2:2016 - PV module safety qualification - Part 2: Requirements for testing
ISO 9806:2017 - Solar energy - Solar thermal collectors - Test methods
technical_guidance: ASTM G173-03 - Standard Tables for Reference Solar Spectral Irradiances
NREL UV Chamber Best Practices Guide
equipment_manuals: UV chamber operation and maintenance manual

test_optimization: Schedule multiple modules in chamber simultaneously if space allows (verify uniformity across all positions)
Perform interim measurements to track degradation kinetics (valuable for failure analysis)
Maintain detailed logs - UV testing is long duration and small details matter
common_pitfalls: Failing to account for lamp aging over test duration - verify irradiance weekly
Inadequate temperature control leading to thermal stress beyond UV effects
Contamination of module surface (dust, fingerprints) affecting UV transmission

troubleshooting.irradiance_drift: Check lamp hours, clean reflectors, verify power supply voltage
troubleshooting.temperature_instability: Check cooling fans, clean air filters, verify ambient conditions
troubleshooting.sensor_reading_errors: Check for condensation on sensor, verify wiring, compare to backup sensor
